media$description.$t: Yes I know I cut off my head.  Hey no one is perfect!  Learn how to ask someone where they are going in ASL

media$description.$t: In this video learn how to sign, "Good Morning, Good Afternoon, Good Evening and Good Night"

media$description.$t: Here is the last video of the baseball series and it is jammed pack with signs!  You getting a bang for your buck, oh wait these videos are free!

content.$t: Here is the last video of the baseball series and it is jammed pack with signs!  You getting a bang for your buck, oh wait these videos are free!

title.$t: Ellen's Dance Dare, Most interesting Man in the World

media$title.$t: Ellen's Dance Dare, Most interesting Man in the World

media$description.$t: How many people can say the danced behind the world's most interesting man?  I don't always dance, but when I do it's behind Jonathan Goldsmith

content.$t: How many people can say the danced behind the world's most interesting man?  I don't always dance, but when I do it's behind Jonathan Goldsmith

media$description.$t: Red Sox had an embarrassing loss last night,  I will tell you the score only if you send me a video of yourself signing asking me who won and or what the score was.  You will be able to sign those questions after watching this video!

content.$t: Red Sox had an embarrassing loss last night,  I will tell you the score only if you send me a video of yourself signing asking me who won and or what the score was.  You will be able to sign those questions after watching this video!

media$description.$t: Learn how to sign ININING and how to incorporate that into first, second, and third inning etc. You're going to learn the sign for point(s) and whether you are down in the game (hopefully not)

content.$t: Learn how to sign ININING and how to incorporate that into first, second, and third inning etc. You're going to learn the sign for point(s) and whether you are down in the game (hopefully not)

media$description.$t: One of my favorite memories playing softball as a kid was when I played a game and it was the ideal situation.  Picture this with me.  Bottom of the 9th, tied game 3 balls 2 strikes.  I'm at bat.  Talk about pressure!!!  I got a home run and won the game!  It was one of my favorite sports moment.  So anyways learn how to sign single, double, triple, hit, homerun and grand slam in this video :)

content.$t: One of my favorite memories playing softball as a kid was when I played a game and it was the ideal situation.  Picture this with me.  Bottom of the 9th, tied game 3 balls 2 strikes.  I'm at bat.  Talk about pressure!!!  I got a home run and won the game!  It was one of my favorite sports moment.  So anyways learn how to sign single, double, triple, hit, homerun and grand slam in this video :)

media$description.$t: Learn how to sign "First, Second, Third and Home Base"

content.$t: Learn how to sign "First, Second, Third and Home Base"

media$description.$t: It's baseball season!!!! So naturally I had to show some baseball signs so you can talk about the Red Sox in American Sign Language.  Have fun learning these!

content.$t: It's baseball season!!!! So naturally I had to show some baseball signs so you can talk about the Red Sox in American Sign Language.  Have fun learning these!

media$description.$t: Dodgeball and dancing what's not to love?!

content.$t: Dodgeball and dancing what's not to love?!

media$description.$t: Fly like a butterfly, sting like a...tiger?  Learn how to sign tiger and butterfly in this video.  Get as creative as you when signing butterfly.  Whether  your butterfly is hanging out relaxing on a flower or flying around from flower to flower.    When signing tiger make sure your face is matching your meaning.  Is it a scary tiger? A friendly tiger?  Keep your  face in check :)

content.$t: Fly like a butterfly, sting like a...tiger?  Learn how to sign tiger and butterfly in this video.  Get as creative as you when signing butterfly.  Whether  your butterfly is hanging out relaxing on a flower or flying around from flower to flower.    When signing tiger make sure your face is matching your meaning.  Is it a scary tiger? A friendly tiger?  Keep your  face in check :)

media$description.$t: Learn how to sign Monkey and Skunk in this video.

content.$t: Learn how to sign Monkey and Skunk in this video.

title.$t: Learn How to Sign Lion and Turtle

media$title.$t: Learn How to Sign Lion and Turtle

media$description.$t:
Every time I hear the word lion I picture my little niece roaring as loud as she can.  It will put a smile on anyone's face :)  The sign for lion is representing the mane of the lion.  
The sign for turtle is very cute and everyone loves it.  Your non-dominant hand is the shell of the turtle and your dominant hand is the body.  Make sure you wiggle your thumb as the head of that turtle.

content.$t:
Every time I hear the word lion I picture my little niece roaring as loud as she can.  It will put a smile on anyone's face :)  The sign for lion is representing the mane of the lion.  
The sign for turtle is very cute and everyone loves it.  Your non-dominant hand is the shell of the turtle and your dominant hand is the body.  Make sure you wiggle your thumb as the head of that turtle.

media$description.$t: Learn these fun signs of Elephant and Snake.  The sign for Elephant is what is called an Iconic sign because it looks like the meaning that is being portrayed.  The sign consists of the trunk of the elephant.  The sign for snake is representing the fangs and the action of the snake attacking.  That's a nice visual!  I know my mom would feel squeamish when doing this sign because she is terrified of snakes!

content.$t: Learn these fun signs of Elephant and Snake.  The sign for Elephant is what is called an Iconic sign because it looks like the meaning that is being portrayed.  The sign consists of the trunk of the elephant.  The sign for snake is representing the fangs and the action of the snake attacking.  That's a nice visual!  I know my mom would feel squeamish when doing this sign because she is terrified of snakes!

media$description.$t: In this video learn how to sign giraffe and frog.  People always get a kick out of doing the long neck for the giraffe and making the throat of the frog.

content.$t: In this video learn how to sign giraffe and frog.  People always get a kick out of doing the long neck for the giraffe and making the throat of the frog.

media$description.$t: In this video you will learn how to sign cat and bear.  Don't forget that when you sign cat, make sure your fingers are up!  When you're signing bear you can change your facial expressions if you want it to be an angry bear or a nice bear.  Think of the book "Goldilocks and the Three Bears"  How would your facial expression look if you were signing baby bear vs. momma bear vs. poppa bear?  They would all be different right?

content.$t: In this video you will learn how to sign cat and bear.  Don't forget that when you sign cat, make sure your fingers are up!  When you're signing bear you can change your facial expressions if you want it to be an angry bear or a nice bear.  Think of the book "Goldilocks and the Three Bears"  How would your facial expression look if you were signing baby bear vs. momma bear vs. poppa bear?  They would all be different right?

media$description.$t: Learn how to sign Kangaroo and dog in this video.  I'm sure there are other signs for these two animals so if you know them please share a video!

content.$t: Learn how to sign Kangaroo and dog in this video.  I'm sure there are other signs for these two animals so if you know them please share a video!

media$description.$t: Learning the signs for animals can be a fun activity to do with children.  What kid doesn't like animals?  Or doesn't know the song "Old Macdonald Had a Farm"?  Most children's books include animals so why not throw in some signs?  Hope you enjoy!

content.$t: Learning the signs for animals can be a fun activity to do with children.  What kid doesn't like animals?  Or doesn't know the song "Old Macdonald Had a Farm"?  Most children's books include animals so why not throw in some signs?  Hope you enjoy!

media$description.$t: Halloween signs!

content.$t: Halloween signs!

media$description.$t: Fun Halloween signs to learn!  Right in time for Halloween!

content.$t: Fun Halloween signs to learn!  Right in time for Halloween!

media$description.$t: Learn some Halloween themed signs!

content.$t: Learn some Halloween themed signs!

media$description.$t: Learn how to sign Which in ASL

content.$t: Learn how to sign Which in ASL

media$description.$t: If you are always losing things and need to ask people WHERE things are, this is a good sign for you to learn.  Make sure your eyebrows are down when you sign "where" unless you are signing a rhetorical question.

content.$t: If you are always losing things and need to ask people WHERE things are, this is a good sign for you to learn.  Make sure your eyebrows are down when you sign "where" unless you are signing a rhetorical question.

media$description.$t: As we continue on with the WH signs learn the sign for "what" don't forget where your eyebrows should be! Down!

content.$t: As we continue on with the WH signs learn the sign for "what" don't forget where your eyebrows should be! Down!

media$description.$t: In ASL whenever you are siging a "wh" sign you want to make sure you're eyebrows are lowered.  Unless you are using the "wh" sign as a rhetorical question then you would raise your eyebrows.

content.$t: In ASL whenever you are siging a "wh" sign you want to make sure you're eyebrows are lowered.  Unless you are using the "wh" sign as a rhetorical question then you would raise your eyebrows.

media$description.$t: Since we don't want to play favorites, you are going to learn how to sign both mom and dad.  Now you have to realize that baby signs are a little different than "grownup" signs because some of the handshapes are a little difficult to do.  For instance when babies sign mom or dad they may start off with signing with just one finger rather than the whole hand.  That is ok!  They will eventually get the correct handshape down!

content.$t: Since we don't want to play favorites, you are going to learn how to sign both mom and dad.  Now you have to realize that baby signs are a little different than "grownup" signs because some of the handshapes are a little difficult to do.  For instance when babies sign mom or dad they may start off with signing with just one finger rather than the whole hand.  That is ok!  They will eventually get the correct handshape down!

media$description.$t: We all want our children to grow up strong and healthy by drinking lots of milk!  Here is the sign for milk.

content.$t: We all want our children to grow up strong and healthy by drinking lots of milk!  Here is the sign for milk.

media$description.$t:
In this video learn the sign for "finish".  This sign can also be used when you are signing to a child and say "all done".  They both have the same meaning.  You can use this sign when the child is eating you can ask if they are all done.  If they are playing you can tell them "all done" or if they are being potty trained you can ask them "all done"  This sign is very useful when working with children.  Another tip is that you can use this sign "finish" to make activities in the past.  For example you could sign EAT FINISH which would mean I ATE or I already ate.
Enjoy!

content.$t:
In this video learn the sign for "finish".  This sign can also be used when you are signing to a child and say "all done".  They both have the same meaning.  You can use this sign when the child is eating you can ask if they are all done.  If they are playing you can tell them "all done" or if they are being potty trained you can ask them "all done"  This sign is very useful when working with children.  Another tip is that you can use this sign "finish" to make activities in the past.  For example you could sign EAT FINISH which would mean I ATE or I already ate.
Enjoy!

media$description.$t: "Please" is very important to learn when it comes to manners.  All parents want their children to say their please and thank yous.  Learn in this video how to sign "please"

content.$t: "Please" is very important to learn when it comes to manners.  All parents want their children to say their please and thank yous.  Learn in this video how to sign "please"

media$description.$t: This is a great sign to teach to children before they are able to speak, people with autism or people who are unable to talk.  Learn how to sign MORE.

content.$t: This is a great sign to teach to children before they are able to speak, people with autism or people who are unable to talk.  Learn how to sign MORE.

media$description.$t: In this video learn how to sign the verb "give".  This is a Directional Sign, which means that you can change the direction of the sign to give it different meaning.  Another thing that you have to think about is if you are giving a cup or a book or a bowl, or anything else, your handshapes are going to be different. Your handshape is going to look like you are holding an imaginary whatever object you are giving.  So make sure that your handshape matches the object.

content.$t: In this video learn how to sign the verb "give".  This is a Directional Sign, which means that you can change the direction of the sign to give it different meaning.  Another thing that you have to think about is if you are giving a cup or a book or a bowl, or anything else, your handshapes are going to be different. Your handshape is going to look like you are holding an imaginary whatever object you are giving.  So make sure that your handshape matches the object.

title.$t: What Size Family do You Have?

media$title.$t: What Size Family do You Have?

media$description.$t:
Think about it (in ASL of course)  When describing the size of your family would you sign "large family" and "small family" the same way?  No of course not.  The next question is how would you sign it?  Now in Signed Exact English (SEE) you would sign LARGE/SMALL and FAMILY.  Not in ASL because ASL is meaning based not word based.  So watch the video and learn how to sign large and small family the same way only by changing the movement of the sign and your facial expression.

Another thing to think about is how you can show different feelings about your family just by changing your facial expressions.  You will learn that here as well.

content.$t:
Think about it (in ASL of course)  When describing the size of your family would you sign "large family" and "small family" the same way?  No of course not.  The next question is how would you sign it?  Now in Signed Exact English (SEE) you would sign LARGE/SMALL and FAMILY.  Not in ASL because ASL is meaning based not word based.  So watch the video and learn how to sign large and small family the same way only by changing the movement of the sign and your facial expression.

Another thing to think about is how you can show different feelings about your family just by changing your facial expressions.  You will learn that here as well.

title.$t: Sign for Light and How to Use it

media$title.$t: Sign for Light and How to Use it

media$description.$t: Now in English we use words to describe the light such as lights off, on, flashing, dimmed etc.  In ASL it is all one sign just signed a little differently.  with different movements and handshapes.  This sign is so visual you can't help but picture what the light looks like while seeing the sign.

content.$t: Now in English we use words to describe the light such as lights off, on, flashing, dimmed etc.  In ASL it is all one sign just signed a little differently.  with different movements and handshapes.  This sign is so visual you can't help but picture what the light looks like while seeing the sign.

media$description.$t: Just by changing the speed of the sign IMPROVE gives the sign different meaning.  Learn how to give so many different meanings to just one sign.

content.$t: Just by changing the speed of the sign IMPROVE gives the sign different meaning.  Learn how to give so many different meanings to just one sign.

media$description.$t:
I apologize for the lighting I didn't realize this until after I taped 5 videos :(  
There are many different kinds of doors, so there are many different ways to sign DOOR.  Here are a few examples of how to sign the different kinds of doors.

content.$t:
I apologize for the lighting I didn't realize this until after I taped 5 videos :(  
There are many different kinds of doors, so there are many different ways to sign DOOR.  Here are a few examples of how to sign the different kinds of doors.

media$description.$t:
Just like how in English where there is more than one word for a meaning there is more than one sign for a specific meaning in ASL.  In this video I am showing how the signs can change depending on the meaning.  

I also discuss how using an ASL dictionary should be a last resort to learning a sign and the video discusses why that it.

This video is to get you thinking in ASL and I hope that now when you are signing you are asking yourself, "does this sign match my meaning"?

content.$t:
Just like how in English where there is more than one word for a meaning there is more than one sign for a specific meaning in ASL.  In this video I am showing how the signs can change depending on the meaning.  

I also discuss how using an ASL dictionary should be a last resort to learning a sign and the video discusses why that it.

This video is to get you thinking in ASL and I hope that now when you are signing you are asking yourself, "does this sign match my meaning"?

media$description.$t: Here is how to ask someone what they are doing tomorrow.  Don't forget about bringing your eyebrows up in the beginning to show the topic and down for the comment.  You see the difference in how ASL structure is different than English.  ASL is topic/comment where English is comment/topic.

content.$t: Here is how to ask someone what they are doing tomorrow.  Don't forget about bringing your eyebrows up in the beginning to show the topic and down for the comment.  You see the difference in how ASL structure is different than English.  ASL is topic/comment where English is comment/topic.

media$description.$t: I have a really fast metabolism so usually if you ask if I'm hungry my answer will be YES.   In this video you will learn how to ask if someone is hungry and how to tell someone that you are hungry.

content.$t: I have a really fast metabolism so usually if you ask if I'm hungry my answer will be YES.   In this video you will learn how to ask if someone is hungry and how to tell someone that you are hungry.

media$description.$t: These two opposites are long and short.  If you haven't seen someone in a long time you would use this LONG sign.  For the sign short we aren't talking height.  Use this SHORT sign for brief periods of time.

content.$t: These two opposites are long and short.  If you haven't seen someone in a long time you would use this LONG sign.  For the sign short we aren't talking height.  Use this SHORT sign for brief periods of time.

media$description.$t: Here is how you sign that you like something and that you don't like something

content.$t: Here is how you sign that you like something and that you don't like something

media$description.$t: When learning a new language you are not going to understand everything that is being signed so here is a way to tell the person signing that you don't understand what they are saying.  Also you are going to see someone ask you this too because they want to make sure they are being understood as well.

content.$t: When learning a new language you are not going to understand everything that is being signed so here is a way to tell the person signing that you don't understand what they are saying.  Also you are going to see someone ask you this too because they want to make sure they are being understood as well.

media$description.$t: Here is how to sign the English word please.  Manners are just as important in ASL as it is in spoken English.

content.$t: Here is how to sign the English word please.  Manners are just as important in ASL as it is in spoken English.

media$description.$t: Happy Thanksgiving!

content.$t: Happy Thanksgiving!

media$description.$t: Here is how to ask someone to repeat what they just signed.  Maybe if they signed a little too fast or not sure of the handshape or movement they used you can sign again

content.$t: Here is how to ask someone to repeat what they just signed.  Maybe if they signed a little too fast or not sure of the handshape or movement they used you can sign again

media$description.$t: When you first start learning it's hard to understand anyone signing.  Here is a way to ask a person to slow down.

content.$t: When you first start learning it's hard to understand anyone signing.  Here is a way to ask a person to slow down.
